citations.narrative:
The facility did not have the required information and records for the acquisition and disposition of two Savannah cats,
one zebra, two Patagonian cavies, and one kangaroo. During the inspection, the licensee stated they weren’t aware they
were required to maintain records for the aforementioned animals they’ve transported for other licensees, or sold on their
own behalf that they transported. Additionally, the facility did not provide acquisition and disposition records for two Yaks,
three Asiatic water buffalo, and one camel. These records were not present during review of the hard copies of records on
hand. The facility stated they would review their electronic records and submit the missing records to the inspector by the
next day, if the missing records were documented electronically. When the records were not received, the inspector
followed-up with the licensee via phone. Upon making contact with the licensee, they stated they were in a training class
at the moment and acknowledged no one from the facility had sent any records to the inspector as agreed upon during
the inspection.
Acquisition and disposition records, including offspring born at the facility, animals transported or otherwise in his or her
possession or under his or her control, are necessary to accurately track animals being used in regulated activities. The
licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records of acquisition/disposition of all animals that fully and correctly disclose
the required information.
Correct by January 31, 2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility has not developed a written environmental enhancement plan for the birds on-hand at the facility. Maintaining
a documented plan ensures adequate provisions are in place to suitably promote and sustain the psychological well-being
and needs of the avian species housed. An enrichment plan must be developed, documented, followed, and approved by
the attending veterinarian, in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and currently accepted professional
standards.
Correct by February 2, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee and a facility representative.
